newsitem.title: FRANCE: SIDO cuts French rapeseed export target to EU.
newsitem.headline: SIDO cuts French rapeseed export target to EU.

text.p: The French oilseeds and protein seeds association SIDO cut its estimate for rapeseed exports to the rest of the European Union, citing a slowdown in EU crushings of rapeseed destined for the food industry.

In its March report SIDO said France may export 1.555 million tonnes of rapeseed to its partners in the European Union in 1996/97 against 1.575 million forecast in January and 1.264 million exported in 1995/96.
But SIDO revised upwards its estimate for French crushings to 790,000 tonnes from 730,000 tonnes in January. This would compare with crushings of 1.005 million in 1995/96.
SIDO said rapeseed grown for industrial use on set-aside land made 75 percent of French crushings.
SIDO also revised downwards its estimate for rapeseed carryover at end June 1997 to 30,000 tonnes from 70,000 forecast in January and 85,000 tonnes at end June 1996.
It held its estimate for 1996 rapeseed output at 2.87 million tonnes, or a rise of six percent over the 2.7 million harvested in 1995.
